page.title: 08BIOGRAPHY
page.content: Our visitor the old us of today. Now though I wouldn't like to be without all the modern comforts I have got used to.We have a washing-machine,a vacuum cleaner, a television and a small car. What I especially like is our modern bathroom with its constant hot water and a shower. What I miss most are the small shops where you could be served by an assistant and where you could buy small amounts of things. I notice the prices! The bus journey I often take now costs 68p. When I was a girl it was two old pence. I also notice how much more it takes to make people happy.They aren't so easily content--children aren't happy unless they have lots of expensive toys.
